title: Authorizes local governments to regulate mining and mine reclamation activities
summary: Authorizes local governments to regulate mining and mine reclamation activities.

       Introduced by M. of A. FINCH -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BUTLER --
         read once and referred to the Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN  ACT  to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to the
         preemption of mining regulation

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  2  of  section  23-2703 of the environmental
    2  conservation law, as amended by chapter 166 of  the  laws  of  1991,  is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    2.  [For  the  purposes  stated herein, this title shall supersede all
    5  other state and local laws relating to the extractive  mining  industry;
    6  provided,  however,  that  nothing  in  this]  THIS  title  shall NOT be
    7  construed to prevent any local government from:
    8    a. enacting or enforcing local laws or ordinances of general  applica-
    9  bility[,  except  that such local laws or ordinances shall not regulate]
   10  REGULATING mining and/or  reclamation  activities  [regulated  by  state
   11  statute, regulation, or permit]; or
   12    b.  enacting or enforcing local zoning ordinances or laws which deter-
   13  mine permissible uses in zoning districts. Where mining is designated  a
   14  permissible  use in a zoning district and allowed by special use permit,
   15  conditions placed on such special use permits shall be  limited  to  the
   16  following:
   17    (i) ingress and egress to public thoroughfares controlled by the local
   18  government;
   19    (ii)  routing of mineral transport vehicles on roads controlled by the
   20  local government;
   21    (iii) requirements and conditions as specified in the permit issued by
   22  the department under this title concerning setback from property bounda-
   23  ries and public thoroughfare rights-of-way natural or man-made  barriers
   24  to  restrict  access,  if required, dust control and hours of operation,

    1  when such requirements and conditions are established pursuant to subdi-
    2  vision three of section 23-2711 of this title;
    3    (iv)  enforcement  of reclamation requirements contained in mined land
    4  reclamation permits issued by the state[; or
    5    c. enacting or enforcing local laws or ordinances regulating mining or
    6  the reclamation of mines not required to be permitted by the state].
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
